title: Marshall McLuhan
summary: Herbert Marshall McLuhan[lower-alpha 1] CC (July 21, 1911 â€“ December 31, 1980) was a Canadian philosopher, whose work is among the cornerstones of the study of media theory.[7][8][9] Born in Edmonton, Alberta, and raised in Winnipeg, Manitoba, McLuhan studied at the University of Manitoba and the University of Cambridge. He began his teaching career as a professor of English at several universities in the United States and Canada before moving to the University of Toronto in 1946, where he remained for the rest of his life.
